	Strong knowledge of CBN and Microfinance regulations.

	Good analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Strong attention to detail and integrity.
	Excellent communication and customer service skills.
	Proficiency with banking software and MS Office applications.


Behavioural Competencies:


	High ethical standards and good judgement.
	Ability to work under pressure and manage tight deadlines.
	Strong organizational and planning skills.
	Proactive, disciplined, and results-oriented.

Job Position: Operations Executive / Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Purpose


	The Operations Executive / Manager ensures smooth end-to-end delivery of commercial transactions &mdash; from deal agreement to execution to payment.
	The role supports the Sales Team by coordinating internal processes, documentation, follow-ups, and cross-department communication to prevent revenue loss caused by operational gaps, delays, or errors.
	Primary Outcome:&nbsp;Deals are executed correctly, on time, and paid for &mdash; with zero leakage.


Key&nbsp;Responsibilities
Deal Execution Coordination:


	Ensure every closed deal is fully documented and properly handed over for execution.
	Track execution milestones to ensure commitments to clients are met.
	Identify potential delays or risks early and drive real-time resolution.


Cross-Department Alignment:
Serve as the central liaison between:


	Sales
	Operations / Delivery
	Finance / Accounts
	Compliance / Admin


Additional duties:


	Ensure workflows move smoothly from one stage to the next.
	Ensure nothing &ldquo;falls through the cracks.&rdquo;


Documentation &amp; Process Control:


	Verify all commercial activities have proper documentation, accurate pricing, and required approvals.
	Ensure compliance with company policies on pricing, discounts, and exceptions.
	Maintain orderly, retrievable project and transaction records.


Financial Closure &amp; Revenue Assurance:


	Track every deal from execution through billing and payment.
	Ensure timely invoicing and follow-up on outstanding receivables.
	Maintain a dashboard of deals in progress, completed, and awaiting financial closure.
	Escalate discrepancies immediately to prevent revenue loss.


Communication &amp; Reporting:


	Provide accurate status updates to Sales Leadership.
	Prepare weekly and monthly reports covering:
	
		Deals executed
		Pending execution tasks
		Outstanding financial closures
		Bottlenecks and actions taken
	
	


Key Metrics (KPIs)
Area:


	Execution Accuracy
	Deal-to-Invoice Speed
	Revenue Leakage
	Task Resolution Speed
	Communication Clarity


KPI:


	95%+ deals delivered without error
	Invoicing completed within agreed timelines
	Zero undocumented or unapproved variations
	Issues resolved within 24&ndash;48 hours
	Consistent and timely status reporting.


Required Experience &amp; Skills


	4&ndash;7+ years in Sales Operations, Client Service, Account Management, Project Management, Commercial Coordination, or Business Operations.
	Experience in FMCG, Telecoms, Banking, Media, Agencies, Tech, or Corporate Services is an advantage.


Skills:


	Strong coordination and follow-through capability.
	Excellent communication and stakeholder management.
	Highly organized and detail-oriented.
	Strong numerical ability and comfort with trackers, dashboards, and documentation.
	Proactive problem-solver with a bias for action.


Personality:


	Assertive without being aggressive.
	Business-minded and commercially aware.
	Calm under pressure and structured in approach.
	Takes initiative without needing follow-up.


Ideal Candidates Profile:
A strong executor who:


	Understands how commercial deals flow across departments,
	Spots gaps before they become problems, and
	Ensures operations run efficiently and smoothly.
	This role is for someone who delivers &mdash; not someone theoretical.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cv and Cover letter to:&nbsp;jobs@cwia.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Operations Executive / Manager Job at CoolFM / WazobiaFM




        
    

        
        CoolFM / WazobiaFM is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Executive / Manager

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Purpose
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Operations Executive / Manager ensures smooth end-to-end delivery of commercial transactions — from deal agreement to execution to payment.
	The role supports the Sales Team by coordinating internal processes, documentation, follow-ups, and cross-department communication to prevent revenue loss caused by operational gaps, delays, or errors.
	Primary Outcome: Deals are executed correctly, on time, and paid for — with zero leakage.


Key Responsibilities
Deal Execution Coordination:


	Ensure every closed deal is fully documented and properly handed over for execution.
	Track execution milestones to ensure commitments to clients are met.
	Identify potential delays or risks early and drive real-time resolution.


Cross-Department Alignment:
Serve as the central liaison between:


	Sales
	Operations / Delivery
	Finance / Accounts
	Compliance / Admin


Additional duties:


	Ensure workflows move smoothly from one stage to the next.
	Ensure nothing “falls through the cracks.”


Documentation & Process Control:


	Verify all commercial activities have proper documentation, accurate pricing, and required approvals.
	Ensure compliance with company policies on pricing, discounts, and exceptions.
	Maintain orderly, retrievable project and transaction records.


Financial Closure & Revenue Assurance:


	Track every deal from execution through billing and payment.
	Ensure timely invoicing and follow-up on outstanding receivables.
	Maintain a dashboard of deals in progress, completed, and awaiting financial closure.
	Escalate discrepancies immediately to prevent revenue loss.


Communication & Reporting:


	Provide accurate status updates to Sales Leadership.
	Prepare weekly and monthly reports covering:
	
		Deals executed
		Pending execution tasks
		Outstanding financial closures
		Bottlenecks and actions taken
	
	


Key Metrics (KPIs)
Area:


	Execution Accuracy
	Deal-to-Invoice Speed
	Revenue Leakage
	Task Resolution Speed
	Communication Clarity


KPI:


	95%+ deals delivered without error
	Invoicing completed within agreed timelines
	Zero undocumented or unapproved variations
	Issues resolved within 24–48 hours
	Consistent and timely status reporting.


Required Experience & Skills


	4–7+ years in Sales Operations, Client Service, Account Management, Project Management, Commercial Coordination, or Business Operations.
	Experience in FMCG, Telecoms, Banking, Media, Agencies, Tech, or Corporate Services is an advantage.


Skills:


	Strong coordination and follow-through capability.
	Excellent communication and stakeholder management.
	Highly organized and detail-oriented.
	Strong numerical ability and comfort with trackers, dashboards, and documentation.
	Proactive problem-solver with a bias for action.


Personality:


	Assertive without being aggressive.
	Business-minded and commercially aware.
	Calm under pressure and structured in approach.
	Takes initiative without needing follow-up.


Ideal Candidates Profile:
A strong executor who:


	Understands how commercial deals flow across departments,
	Spots gaps before they become problems, and
	Ensures operations run efficiently and smoothly.
	This role is for someone who delivers — not someone theoretical.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Cv and Cover letter to: jobs@cwia.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
